What I liked about it was the flavor of the soup- nice, rich and flavorful. It kind of reminds me of a bit of lemongrass with pork broth and a few other spices that I can't quite put my finger on. The bowl was large with a lot of noodles, a pork hock, Vietnamese meat loaf slices, slices of meat and slices of coagulated pork blood. I know, I know, it sounds gross but honestly, don't knock it till you try it. It tastes good especially with all the fresh crunchy veggies added to the soup to add a different level of texture. What I wish was a bit better was the depth of flavor- I feel like the soup was delicious but it could have been kicked up a notch a bit more. 

My honey got the honey chicken with broken rice and it was yummy as well. It was char grilled chicken with fresh green onions on top of it and a heaping pile of broken rice with slices of fresh crisp cucumbers, tomato and carrots.

All in all, I am definitely coming back here to try more of their foods because it was delicious and it definitely hit the spot!

It's a nice clean place.  That's where the pleasantries stop.  First of all, they don't take credit cards but conveniently have a atm machine.  The service is slow and sporadic.  I had the beef stew pho.  It had good flavor but was very greasy and the very little beef.  What little beef there was, was covered mostly in fat.  I also ordered a coconut  tea and barely tasted of coconut.   Prices are not good either.  $7.95 for my bowl and it was small in comparison to other places.   If you want pho, phoget this place.

They have pretty decent pho but I do prefer going to Chinatown for my pho needs. The service is mediocre depends on who you get and how busy it is. They only accept cash, so if you don't have cash except to withdraw from their ATM.

I've gone here for pho twice and the pho (for the price) isn't bad for Vegas. Portions are decent, too (think a bowl radius that's about 2 1/2 deck of cards placed length-wise across). The first time I ordered their rare steak pho, the broth was just the right flavor. This second time around, I had to sriracha the heck out of it to give it some more flavor. I usually drink a good amount of the broth, but not this second time around. I've had their mixed jelly drink as well as their milk tea. If you like multi-colored I-don't-know-what-I'm-tasting drinks, the former is a good pick. Otherwise, I'd stick with the milk tea.

I really enjoyed the pork, shrimp & roll and my wife had seafood pho, which she also liked. This is my wife's favorite Asian restaurant & she is Asian.
Also, we paid cash & survived, tho it was a horrifying experience! Seriously, people!
The first thing that should tip you off about the quality of the pho served here is that the "clever" name only works when you mispronounce "pho".
This place is pho-king awesome. Went here this past weekend and I could literally eat here all day. Not too busy but close to the Strip. Nom nom nom.

Cash Only...WTH???  Seriously?  The cashier was understanding, but really? I just happened to have it on me to cover my order (if I didn't, there's a 3rd party ATM located directly across from the counter.)

My appetizer was also forgotten on my take-out order, for which I now have a 'food credit' when I return.  The chicken broth on the Pho was 'weak' and I had to add to it when I came home.  The vegetables were fresh and plentiful for my order (supersized Pho) all white meat ($1.00 extra) but not enough chicken.

I'll go back to check out other menu items, but it was a bit on the pricey side for this side of town, but all in all, it was a good meal.  

Update*1 year nearly to date...I have NOT gone back*. They didn't win me as a customer.

Little shady that they don't accept Credit Cards but the ATM in the lobby is owned by them and they gladly point you over to it to get cash. Fee $1.50.  Advice bring cash or leave $1.50 less tip. Otherwise food was palatable.

Best Vietnamese out there! I always get the broken rice pork skewers, best flavor ever, no need to add any extra seasoning. 
I love the atmosphere, the servers are so nice and recognize me every time I go in.
I come here everytime I want pho. Service is good and the food comes out quick! Their Thai tea is really good too. Overall my son and I love coming here

Located on rainbow and windmill/robindale in SW
i like this place near home. Open from 10am to 10pm.
All the staff is very pleasant and helpful. 
I always order meat ball pho and some egg rolls.
for 2 pho and some egg rolls you are looking for $25

Service is slow and take forever for the food to come out.
The noodle was just okay but expansive.
Love this place have tried many different pho places with hubby and we really love this place. They add veggies and alot of meat to your pho so no disappointment!

We went there for lunch on a weekday.  Worst customer service. One of our waiters was extremely grumpy and got upset when we werent ready to order. I got the grilled chicken and it was RAW. and cash only. Awful experience and mediocre food. Never going back again.

Jennie Pho is my go to pho place when I visit Vegas. Good food, quick friendly service. Good selection on menu. I usually get the P1 Jennie Pho and some egg rolls. Love it all the time and so affordable.

Jennie Pho is located in a free standing restaurant in front of a strip mall on Rainbow Boulevard just north of Windmill Drive. 

After a long day of moving we decided to start trying some of the places in our new neighborhood that we've never tried before. I had a combo platter that consisted of a moist and tender grilled pork chop. That pork chop was so freakin tender that I was able to take the first few bites by cutting off pieces with the side of my fork! Also included was 3 large shrimp a fried egg, and a sizable portion of rice!

I haven't tried the pho yet but my friends weren't overly impressed. They both ordered the Jenni Special. They noted that it was okay but that they have had much better at other places in town(including several places in Chinatown and the Lemongrass Cafe on Eastern Ave.). I am quite sure I will be back to try it myself and at that time I'll be able to update this review regarding their pho. 

The service was quick and friendly, but then again the place was pretty dead when we went in there yesterday afternoon. 

I guess the biggest complaint I had about my experience yesterday was that we were ambushed by a couple of very aggressive gnats/flies. Very freaking annoying when you're trying to eat!

Be aware that they only accept cash. They also have an ATM inside for your money gouging convenience.

I did like this place enough to the point that I will return and try more things. It does have the potential to bump up to 4 stars and it's so close to the house that it would be great to make this a regular spot.

Until further notice though...it will be..

3 stars.

Food yeah okay I guess. The service at when we are there really sucked. Didn't bring the food out on time. They didn't bring the food out for our group all at the same time. Some people were done eating what other people are waiting for their food. They didn't bring out the silverware or chopsticks and people were trying to find anything I can to eat with. They showed a little bit and attitude and didn't
The spring roll was terrible, their suppose to have slices of pork in it all they had was couple of shrimp and shit load of veggies.it was more like salad roll.

Two words: pho-cking fantastic. My favorite place to grab some pho. It's a shame it's so far away from where I live, or else I'll be their #1 customer. I just can't get over their broths and how it's so tasty and refreshing until the very last drop. Sure, it may be more on the oily side but that's ok, I always ask for an extra bowl and carefully spoon out the liquid layers of fat.

The service is quite good; ample amount of waiters and waitresses hanging around ready to help you with whatever. 

My only gripe about this place is that they don't accept cards! Debit or credit, doesn't matter. I think everyone will agree that in this day and age that's pretty unacceptable. They have an ATM but still, it takes an X amount of money for the transaction. I actually told them I'll stop by a BoA and come back. Luckily there's one not too far away. However, damage has been done, one demerit for you, jenni; Upgrade your cash registers!

Regardless, this place has awesome pho.
Delicious pho and beef stew noodle soup. We've been here at least 10 times.

Used to be my favorite spot,but that was before I got to dine next to a dying cockroach and tendony , chewy chicken. My stomach was killing me directly after. This place has taken a nose dive. Get it together please!

My husband and I have been to this restaurant few times, the food is good, but the service is really poor, the last time when we went there, the waiter seated us, we were left there for about 10 minutes. The Asian people who came after us got their food first, and we were the last even we were there earlier than the others . We are not going back any more..

this place here is awesome!, too bad it's so far from my house, there's nothing like this on the northwest part of town. the pho is great and they're not stingy on their portions what so ever. a meal for two usually under 15 bucks!

the staff is always friendly and place is very clean

Always a great place to go when you have a hangover or cold. Best casual Pho spot that's not on Spring Mountain. Super clean restaurant, and super good food! The pho is so flavorful. Jenni means business and is great at what she does. Some servers are just not all there. haha! But I go there for the food not the service. haha!

The worse bowl of pho i've had in Vegas.

I was willing to sacrifice a little because I didnt want to make the drive to Spring Mtn.

There's way too many other Pho options.  Don't waste your time here.

No need to elaborate on the food -- it sucked.

I've tried countless pho places before and I'll have to say Jenni Pho tops them all.  She doesn't put MSG in her pho and the flavor is A+.

I brought my Indian vegetarian friends to eat here and they had something for everyone: vegetarian pho, chicken broth, tomato based broth, tofu spring rolls, you name it!

Everyone loved the food and will definitely keep coming back.

It sucks that the Spring Mountain location closed down but the food here is worth the 15 minute trek from the strip.
I love this place. Staff is always nice and welcoming. Pho broth is delicious. They give you enough of everything. Always fill up your water.
Very bad service! Not friendly at all! Especially the Mexican girl and Asian girl who worked on this day! Wouldn't recommend coming save your time and money go somewhere where they will respect you!
Oh god where do I begin. The food is disgusting. The service is terrible. I'm never eating here again.

The pho is better than Pho Kim Long and the service is more welcoming. 

I've been here on numerous occasions during my last few trips to Vegas and haven't had a bad meal, yet. 

I usually get the veggie and tofu pho which is pretty flavorful. Another winner is the egg roll bun. They seriously give you like 3-4 egg rolls in that one bowl! Portions are huge here, so you only need to order one item. I don't think we've ever ordered appetizers and I frequent this place with guy friends. 

The Jenni Pho is supposed to be tasty as well, altho that is just what my friends have said. 

Overall, a decent place if you've got a hankering for Vietnamese food. They also serve boba drinks. 

Cash only.
they serve pretty good pho with a good amount of noodles.  But not fond of the tofu they use and it's so silly they only take cash.

I'm giving this restaurant a 5 star for Vegas standards.  I live in San Francisco and have traveled far and wide for a good bowl of pho. I've been to Jenni Pho 4 times and it has always given me my Pho fix. 

 It's all about the soup base when it comes to pho. Soup is savory (authentic and good ingredients) and not overly salty (MSG) tasting.  I've had the opportunity to try 3 types of noodles on my visit, Pho Dat Biet, Bun Bo Hue, and Bun Riue.  All very tasty and more importantly very authentic.

No complaints!, Service was good, food was great! I ordered the pho with chicken (&1.00 extra ) for the white meat, the meal was huge, couldn't finish it! Prices very reasonable! My daughter ordered the "Broken Rice" dish with pork skewers, which she also loved!! We will definitely return to Jenni Phos, our new go to place for lunch!

Is there a negative star rating.  The worst service or lack of I think I have every had.  Got there at 6:30, several tables sat down after us.  Immediately order Thai Tea and Pot Stickers.  Waited over 15 minutes for the Tea was not made correctly, forgot the condensed milk.  Finally came back to take out order, still have not received the pot stickers after 30 minutes.  Tables around us started to get there food and we could not even get a refill on water.  Finally brings out two of our four orders.  Half way done with the Pho bowls and other two still don't have their broken rice plates.  Pot stickers finally come out. We are done with our Pho when the rice dishes finally come out.  There is so much bones are grizzle in chicken it could not be ate and the pork tasted and looked like fried spam.  Awful!!  Brought the check by put out a credit card and was told it is cash only.  Had to leave three girls there by themselves while going to ATM.  Tried to complain when I got back with the cash and the guy pretended like he did not speak English.  $60 completely down the drain and had to feed the kids when we got home.  BEWARE!!!!

I went back for the pho and had to reduce my rating, I must've just been really hungry last time.

The broth here is salty like Pho Saigon 8 but not as good.  I ordered "extra tendon" but only found one small piece in my entire bowl.  

As others have pointed out, they charge for refills on fountain soda which, in my book, is an automatic one-star deduction, and it's cash only - not cool.  Also they have no banh mi bread here, and I enjoy dipping my baguette in the broth...

I probably won't go back here unless I'm feeling too lazy to drive to C-town.  Also, they have a spicy blood dish I may want to try.

The only time I will give a place a 1 star is if I never want to go back. Jenni Pho is such a place. I tried it because it was closer to home and didn't want to drive to Chinatown. I ordered pho with chicken. The broth wasn't bad but I ended up just eating the noodles and some broth. The chicken was just plain nasty. It seemed like it was just the left over crap from the chicken. The pieces were really grisly and tough. Did not enjoy it at all. Oh and they don't take credit cards. WTF? What business doesn't take credit cards?? They have an ATM in the restaurant. I ended up paying the fee from the ATM and got charged another fee from my bank. Yeah. Not going back. Ever.

It is so hard to rate pho because it is not food that's supposed to be "fine dining".  Jenni pho was pretty good overall.

 The Gf ordered chicken pho, which was a bad idea. The obvious clue not to order chicken pho came when they only mentioned via a piece of paper that chicken pho is offered. 

My beef pho, however, was the second best I've had in Lv.  If I hadzn't seen the quality of chicken used in my pho-virgin's meal, this is 4.5 star. Overall, Jenni pho is an easy 3.5 stars.  Price is standard and food is good. 

Will edit review after second and third try.
Great Pho! I usually get the pick 5 meats! Always fresh and good portion! Also spring rolls are pretty amazing! Prices are very reasonable not like strip prices!

I came with my family to this restaurant and I enjoyed this place. Just remember, cash only, so come prepared. 

My friend told me about the broths mad how it tastes better than most other places. That right there got me because I do enjoy drinking soup broths! So I got the flank and steak pho while my brother got the honey chick, my brother got the charbroiled pork, and my dad got the Jenni pho, which has all the meats that you can add. We also got the fresh spring rolls as our appetizers, just to see how they are. 

When our spring rolls came, they were pretty standard like you would get at any other Vietnamese place. The sauce was a little bit different than most  other places though. The sauce had a peanut taste to it, but also this Chinese pasty/bread aftertaste to it, which I particularly liked. It might be weird that I like that pastry aftertaste, or even that I could even tell that it was there. That could just be me being weird, but the sauce was good!

When our food came, the first thing I wanted to do was to try their broth, and it was different than most places too, and in a good way! Their noodles and meats are pretty standard. Their prices were fairly standard as well for the amount of food that came, and it was a pretty decently sized bowl; I was satisfied. My mom's chicken was pretty good. It was juicy and tender the whole way around. My brother's pork was pretty tasty as well. 

Overall, the food was really good. I enjoyed it a lot, maybe a little more than Pho So 1 or Pho Kim Long I would say. That's really subjective, but there was nothing about Jenni Pho I didn't like. The service was even good! Our server Justin was really helpful and checked up on us regularly. If you're in the area, give this place a shot!

jenni pho has excellent customer service. All the waiters were very accommodating & sweet. The honey grilled chicken is one of my favorites on the menu& its very juicy & tasty! The pho is also the best! I have a pho place right next to my house but i'd rather drive to Jenni Pho to get my fix!
Deliciousness in a bowl that's all I gotta say! I come here every Sunday cause I can't get enough of it.

My family and I absolutely love this place, and it is a weekly favorite. I used to go to Pho So 1 -- but we prefer the broth here and it is much closer to home (and super clean). The service is excellent. Steven, Han, and Bin (I hope I spelled their names correctly) couldn't be friendlier or more welcoming. The owner is also there most times we go, and she is always kind and goes around to each table. We order the rare steak Pho, sometimes shrimp, and egg rolls. The iced coffee, thai tea, and coconut juice are delicious, as well.
I was so happy to find this place. The beef pho was amazing! This best I've had in Vegas so far...

I've eaten at a lot of pho places in California and Nevada and jenni pho is definitely one of the best! Definitely the best on rainbow Blvd. The appetizers were on point spring roles and potstickers! The meat melts in your mouth soft!

This was my first experience trying Pho, and I was pleasantly surprised. I had ordered the steak Pho and a plain ice tea. For $7.95 you get a plate of basil, jalapenos, and bean sprouts with your Pho. The broth was flavorful, and the meat was very tender. The steak came thinly sliced, and there was just the right amount of it in the soup. The noodles were translucent and also had a nice texture. All in all, the food great and I will soon be going back for seconds. 

Cons: Yes, this place accepts cash only. Also, they don't refill drink in a timely manner.

Other than that, Jenni Pho is a great place to dine:)

The Pho, egg rolls and Boba use to be good here.  All three are not anymore.
The Boba is gross the Pho is too strong and the egg rolls are burnt.  I only go to pho Kim long now.

I don't understand why people are giving this awesome place bad reviews. It is DELICIOUS CLEAN and CHEAP! What more do you want for a local little Pho place with great prices and service. We always get good service and the Seafood or Rare Steak Pho is my favorite. The broth is savory and never bland. It's not too salty ( I LOVE SALT) just perfect temperature and the portions are huge. I love their potstickers and egg rolls. I also had their Vermacelli tomato Seafood with no squid and that was pure heaven too. Their sauces on the table are great quality. The open kitchen window is very nice and allows you to see what a small kitchen can put out, which is deliciousness in a bowl. Their boba flavored drinks are all very good, THey have a huge selection of endless iced, coffee, smoothie and teas with or without boba they're all REALLY TASTEY! I live close by and so happy I can go there at least once a week. I love Pho and have had many and this is right up there if not better than some of the Spring Mountain Phos. PLUS they are VERY friendly, they aren't all weird and rude just because I'm not Vietnamese like some places are in Spring Mtn. Don't knock it till you try it and I would say I have a very sofisticated palate and have a good sense for what's good & bad. I'm not picky I'll try anything once. This place is a must!

I promise if you order a simple Pho to start with for those of you who are just starting you won't be dissapointed. LOVE THIS PLACE I'm gonna go now just writing this review made my mouth water!

Cash only but you can eat like a King with $20

This place is awesome. The service was quick and they were very attentative. As for the food...YUM!!! Spring rolls were delish n fresh and the Pho was flavorful. It was also very busy with people walking in every 3 mins.  Definitely recommend this place anyday!  oh yeah, the portions are huge and they don't give you the option to order a smaller bowl and you have to be 12 and under to order a kids size bowl. Other than that  great food.

Finally decided to try this little vietnamese cafe & overall it was okay. Cute, clean venue. Can be somewhat cramped, so dont go here for a big birthday dinner. One star for the open kitchen. One star for the standard customer service, nothing too special. & the last star for the ok pho. I ordered the pho tai bowl. Taste wasnt satisfying, but still good. Sweet soupy taste. As for the meat, mine was dried up like a soggy jerky. Id go back, but Jenni Pho wouldnt be my first pho pick. Pho So 1 & pho kim long are great.

I'm no expert at Vietnamese food, but I think this place is pretty good. The pho is good and the portions are big and cheap. Leftovers even taste great the day after. The veggie springrolls might be the best thing about this place. The staff was very friendly and attentive. If they accepted credit cards I would have given them a higher rating. Despite that I'll be back.

When you walk in you're immediately greeted with the savory smell of the food being cooked in the kitchen. Not soon after you're greeted by whoever is working and seated right away. My friend and I got spring rolls to start and we each ordered pho. Everything was so fresh and so delicious! I'm very critical of the broth in my pho and Jenni Pho hit the nail on the head! Overall this place gets 4 stars, 2 for the very attentive service and 2 for the delicious food. If they weren't cash only this place would be 5 stars easily. I'll definitely be back!

I'm baffled by the bad reviews because I really like this place!  Come on now, you have to give it up for the play on words... Jenni Pho sounds like Jennifer.  How clever!  (Okay, maybe it was a coincidence but I got a kick out of it.  Then again I am easily amused.)

Pros: modern decor, reasonable prices, really good food (especially the pho), only good Vietnamese restaurant on that side of town, very friendly and accommodating staff

Cons: parking is tight, cash only, service can be slow

The pho is huge, has tasty broth, and lots of tender meat.  My only other favorite place is Pho Kim Long in China Town but Jenni Pho has won me over.

Cash Only!

Yes, I had to withdraw money from the conveniently located ATM within the restaurant.  My hubby wanted pho, so I picked up food here for him and I since it was close to where I was volunteering.  We had tried Pho Annie not too long ago, and we thought the broth was way too sweet, so decided to give Jenni Pho a try.

The broth was much better here, BUT, the noodles were overdone.  I to go the food, so it is super important that they don't over cook the noodles because once we open the container when we got home, it was a big blob of noodles.  

Overall, Pho broth is decent, decent amount of meat, but the noodles can be done better.  Would we order food here again?  Maybe.

So.. My cousins and I went here because we were craving pho and spring rolls, ordered those two. Waited patiently for our food. I noticed that the table next to us got their food a lot faster than us. After getting their attention 10 minutes later, we let Travis our waiter know that we ordered spring rolls and pot stickers. Still waited patiently... Got the pot stickers half way through our meal and asked for a box because we were already full. Not to mention that I still never got my spring rolls. After the meal we let Travis know again that we would like a box for the pot stickers and that we still NEVER got our spring rolls. He immediately said he would cancel our order (that's cool, not like I wanted them or anything. *sarcasm intended) an apology was never said, but he did throw in a $2.00 discount on our entire check. THANKS BUDDY. Worst customer service I've had.

Picked up a to-go order from here. It's not convenient that it's cash only but they do have an ATM at this location with a $1.50 ATM fee. 

The pearls for the boba tea were undercooked and hard. The pho noodles were overcooked and a bit mushy but the broth had a pretty good flavor and the Jenni Pho had lots of meat. I did love how they didn't skimp on the fresh veggies and herbs for the pho and egg rolls. Fresh romaine lettuce, mint leaves, basil and bean sprouts. Their fish sauce for the egg rolls was very plain though. I had to add some chili garlic sauce and lemon to it to give it the right flavor. 

Overall it was okay. With so many other good options in Vegas though, I don't know if I'd go back. Plus it seemed pretty pricey. $22 for pho, egg rolls and a regular boba? I don't know about that.

Flank steak pho was great. Remember to bring cash as they don't accept credit/debit cards.  Service was very good, but the a/c was warm in the restaurant even with fans running full blast.  We'll be back when it cools off in the fall!

I was really excited when my favorite Vietnamese restaurant closed in my area and this one opened up, but was very disappointed after trying it a couple of times.  I'm not sure what the difference is in their preparation, but it just didn't seem as fresh as some other places I've been.  And I thought the staff was unfriendly.  Disappionted to say the least.  I love Vietnamese food, but not here.  

Cute place, but there are better options out there.  :(

I haven't see too many pho restaurants in town delivered the pho with steaming hot broth! Love it! I ordered the lunch combo no. 3 and it was delicious. The combo came with a bowl of pho, grilled pork and appetizers, moreover, it also came with a drink and a scoop of ice cream. 

Love their warm friendly  services and always have smiles on them. 

Parking is available inside the plaza, easy to park. 

They accept VISA & MasterCard. 

Jenni~~~~Pho, you rocks!

You cannot go wrong with Jenni Pho when in Las Vegas. Their newest location has closed down since we were last in Vegas, but luckily the original location still stands strong. We typically live in Vegas during the winter months and dine at Jenni's often. We love the buy 2 get 1 on the Boba teas, for that boba on the go. I always get the P10 (Gna Pho) with white meat chicken. I absolutely love the flavor of the chicken and broth and the freshness of the pho toppings. My husband always gets one of the rice plates, today he got the grilled BBQ pork skewer and shrimp rice plate (c13). The portions at Jenni Pho are great for the price. The service is always great and everyone is always friendly. It is a little off the beaten path for a tourist, but if you're in the area, you will not be disappointed with stopping at Jenni Pho!
Follow our adventures  thenumads.com

I was craving a bowl of hot yummy pho and popped into Jenni Pho after a rock climbing workout. I was greeted and seated promptly. The pot stickers were buy one get one (rock on!) which was a nice surprise. The pho - was delicious! Soooo delicious I did a take-out session later on in the week. The takeout was bland and blah. It lacked the punch and pizzaz I had experienced in house.  :)  Hooray for dine-in.....  :( Boo for takeout

I used to come here all the time but at some point their customer service was out of wack and took forever for food to come out and made me walk out on them plus they weren't even busy. On top of that they brought appetizer and the main course at the same time couple of times so I stopped coming here for awhile. But hate to admit that JenniPho is my absolute FAVORITE!!! I just had Veggie & Tofu Pho and it was amazing as always. Their service got a lot better and food came out quickly. I am happy :D

This is my go-to spot for Bun Bo Hue whenever I'm in Las Vegas, and it's not far from my timeshare either. The first time I discovered Jenni Pho was about five years ago and I think we came here to eat every single day. Every. Single. Day.

The Good: It's cheap, the place is really nice inside, and the Pho is pretty damn decent. Good location if you're in the Southwest right on Rainbow. 

The Bad: The service is abrupt and aloof. I went to pick up take out and the guy behind the takeout counter was surfing the internet, apparently I was SEP and rather than say something polite like "the cashier will be here shortly" he just chose to make it mega-awkward and surf (what I assume was some highly captivating pornography) defiantly.

When you get Pho in the restuarant you feel like you're getting a ton of meat. When you get it via take out and get to see it in it's deconstructed form, you're getting about a dollars worth of lunch meat. Not good. I strongly suspect you get far more meat for dining in.

Horrifying: The meatballs, like a lot of Pho places, are just bad. Also they are almost perfectly evocative of reproductive organs. I believed this was my palate until I had good traditional Pho balls at other Pho restaurants. The same is true, even more so, for the tripe. It's about as chewy as it can get here. I am not accounting this into the score though, because I think this may be cultural. 

Still recommended, just don't expect to be blown away.

My buddy read about this place off of YELP so we gave it a try.  The place is clean and the staff is attentive.  I'm not much of a Pho eater but the dishes are tasty and the service was great.  The prices are descent and I would definitely go back to Jenni Pho.
The eggrolls here are deeelish. The pho has pretty good flavor as well...but I didn't like the honey chicken.

There is nothing uncommonly good or bad about the food at Jenni Pho.  Pho is pho.  Unless your culinary skills are as nonexistant as mine, it's not a dish one can screw up.

But service is indeed something a restaurant can easily screw up on -- and you'll probably experience that first-hand when eating there.  Although there's this one guy who's always chipper and helpful, hospitality appears to be a foreign concept to the rest of the staff.  

Too bad there isn't another pho place in the southwest part of town.

PRO
- Parking plentiful
- Nice decor

CON
- Service sucks
- Many items on menu are frequently "unavailable"

They have several locations throughout Vegas now and they compete well with other Vietnamese places.  Service is decent, although sometimes waiters or waitresses give out the vibe that they hate their job.  Also the vegetables that come along with the Pho such as cilantros and limes is very limited here in comparison to other places like Pho Kim Long.  Food is decent and im just used to having a lot of vegetables brought out especially when two people order Pho.  Another thing that's annoying is they only accept cash...  I am an occasional gambler so the less cash I have in my pocket the less I will gamble...
I love this place. Im loving the beef and steak pho. And I basically order everyone of the appetizers.

I don't understand what everyone is talking about but I loove this place !!!! Very clean and honestly the most amazing service ever. Every Time I come here they greet me like if it's my first time. Very sweet and knowledgeable about the menu. I don't eat pork and so they made sure to use a different broth for my amaaaaaziiiing phô! The potstickers are actually made with chicken !!! I love it! I just love this place . I wish every phô place would have half the amazing service I get when I come to this location. I'll still be very happy and satisfied.

I like the rice dishes here.  Pho is good too but I've had more flavorful broth in other places.  Portion sizes are small in my opinion but I'm a big eater.   Wish they didn't only accept cash which makes it inconvenient for many of us.

I'm kinda biased when it comes to Pho, cuz I've had the REAL deal Holyfield back in San Jose....but this ain't bad.  Broth is good but not fantastic, you  can really taste the difference when you have been eating the best.  But I do have to say it's better than Saigon 8 (I think they bribed the columnists) sneaky azians.....meat was ok, not alot of noodles here.....they have a see through kitchen which is different, they usually don't like you to see the kitchen in case they drop something (u know that happens all the time in asian joints) but nice decor either way.

til next  time, good eating!

I'm still on a search for really good Pho.....

Terrible Service. 

First time I came here they refused to accept my card and MADE me withdraw money from an ATM that was already conveniently inside (hmm wonder why). 

Gave it a second chance and ordered to go. When I came to pick up my food, they refused to accepted my credit card and asked for a pin when I clearly stated MULTIPLE times that my credit card did not have a pin. The cashier proceeded to stare at me as if I was stupid and insisted that I needed to enter my pin even after incessantly repeating that I don't have a pin and have NEVER been asked for a pin (I've had this credit card for 7 years). In the end she just stares at me with a "well that's your fault that you don't know your non-existent pin".

Wasted my gas driving all the way here to leave without my food. I'm all for second chances as I am a server at a restaurant myself but the service is terrible at this place and I will NOT be back and will make sure to warn all my friends to not patron a restaurant with such terrible customer service.
I would give this place zero stars. Beware of this place they have been on dirty dining. Yuck!!!!

I am so glad to be back at Jenni Pho after knowing Sammy Pho has changed owners.

My father and I always come here and eat pho once a week because we love eating pho!! 

I really appreciate the workers because they treat us like we are some kind of VIP. We would always crack jokes and have conversations. The workers checks up on out orders asking for concerns or if there is anything else they can get for us.

I always get brisket pho with my dad and we love the broth and the fresh vegetables!! All that matters to me is to eat at a clean restaurant with good fresh food.

I'd you have not yet been to this place, I really recommend this place to you
Small place but very good. I was one of the 1st hundred customers and have a VIP card. During the winter I was there often! Now there's a new pho place down the street that will compete with them.

The best pho place in Vegas..  The steak (tai) is cut thin and doesn't look like "mermaid" meat..  Typical pho restaurant prices, the only downside is they messed up my order once..  Other than that, if you're in the southwest side of town, I definitely recommend it..
Really good service and it is right near my house. The food is delicious. Good for a quick and easy Vietnamese fix.

Call order food to go the girl said 15 20 man show up 20 man later the food was not ready paid for the food and the girl said 2mn sat there and wait and wait and wait and another waiter said almost done and wait and wait finally 30mn or so the waiter bring out the food the place was not that busy and take them forever to cook
Nothing special about this place. Food was ok, the menu was pretty pricey. I probably won't return. Sorry!

Yelp Challenge! Started 8/20/2011 (8 of 365).

Unfortunately, this is not one of my go to places for Pho.  But it is actually good enough to go to because it's the closest place to go to for Pho without the far drive to China town.  

The soup here is kind of bland but there is actually enough taste to make you come back on a rainy day.  It's actually a plus if you're looking for low sodium I guess.  There isn't much to the broth and you definitely have to dip all your meat in some kind of sauce before you eat it.  The fried egg rolls are good though and they come with lettuce to wrap it in.

If you want good authentic Pho, I suggest making the drive out.  But if you're super hungry and you're OK with good soup that you don't have to make yourself, go to Jenni Pho.

This is quickly rising to the top of our favorite pho places.  Our third visit today and we took 2 pho newbies along for a food adventure.  

It did not disappoint.  We had the egg rolls which were served piping hot and extra, tasty, crispy.  They were accompanied by fresh cilantro and plenty of fresh green leaf lettuce for wrapping.  

Jenni Pho is nice because they offer chili paste and chili oil in the condiment tray.  The restaurant is cute and very clean and tidy.  The service is friendlier than most.  

Vietnamese coffee was pleasing as ever -  a super strong, super sweet zing to start your day!  We were craving pho early and were so pleased to find out they opened at 9:30 am! What a breakfast treat!

The broth was very nicely flavored, and the portion was more than adequate. Everyone was pleased with the meal! Warm happy bellies make a great start to any day.

2 Vietnamese coffees, 1 coke, 1 hot tea, 1 coconut water, 4 bowls of pho and 2 orders of egg rolls = $53.
Jenni Pho is okay. The only thing on the menu that's edible is the pho, everything else is just not up to par. WHAT SUCKS- Cash only and service.
Very good pho and spring rolls. Service was also very good for carryout and they accepted credit card as payment.
Wow great pho, awesome ambiance and Jenni walks around and talks to all her guests personably. She's great and staff all are so nice

I must admit, I only ever have the seafood pho, cuz I'm a pescetarian.  It is always great!  Everyone is very friendly!  It's always a great experience!

It's very clean.  The kitchen is open to the dining area.  And even better, I've seen the employees eat there!  So you know it's clean.

Can't say enough about it.

I love the fact that they have buy one get one going on for their pot-stickers. I'm a huge fan of them. Their Pho was pretty OK.

3 star because of the service. They don't really have very attentive servers. 

Casual ambience. cool set up.

will go there again for pot-stickers.

Here's a quote from an article I think Jenni Pho should consider:

"The San Francisco Fed reported that in 2014, only 14 percent of consumer purchases were made in cash; the rest were in some form of electronic commerce."

"I avoid places that require you to get cash out of their ATM machines, at which I will pay my bank a fee and the machine a fee," she said. "I will simply go elsewhere."

http://www.cdcgamingreports.com/has-cash-been-dethroned/

The food there is great tho!!   =]

My boyfriend and I love this place and love the owners! My first regular restaurant in Las Vegas and boy, was i welcomed! Amazing pho and exceptional service. I love the pot stickers that are buy 1 get 1 free. yummy

Had the P1 Jenni Pho. Meat is very good. At other pho places the meat can taste kind of rancid but not here. Very clean establishment. The workers are very polite and sweet. Great place to go if you're too far from chinatown.

First place I ever had Pho, so I'm biased. But service is friendly always. Quick service.  Clean environment. Good price for good food. Cash only though, always have to stop at the bank before I go there. On a cold rainy night, this place hit the spot!

I've Never eaten Pho before, but I really like this place. It's convenient to where I live, and the prices are reasonable. There isn't alot of seating, and the service does lack from time to time, but I'd go back, the food is very good!!! Yep, I'm a Fan.....and, I'd go back!!! =)

The meat had too much gristle and sinew. Made it a bit more tough to chew. The broth was tasted greasy. Also, it's 2015. There's no reason to be cash only unless you're trying to evade taxes or something.
They started accepting cards now as well. The food is average and the service is still average as well. It is though one of the nicest places for pho near the area.

If ur not into beef or pork, then u probably shouldn't eat here because mostly all there soups are beef/pork based (even their chicken pho). They give u a tomato based option, but it just ruins the whole pho experience! I did not want tomato soup! 
Also, our kids got a chicken tender meal which was suppose to come with soda, that they didn't get til after they ate because the waiter forgot. Ended up taking the can drinks home. The waiters r friendly, just forgetful.
So, guess we'll be eating at any other pho place, because this is the only one that didn't have chicken based soups, or veggie based soups.

I ate here about two weeks ago at the last minute. I ordered the pho with vegetables and tofu only. It came out marginally hot. It looked sketchy and I was surprised I didn't get sick.  What turns me off about this place is that it's cash only. It reminded me of another pho place I went to that had no sign that there was a debit card minimum. Since I had no cash, they pointed me to an ATM onsite that charged a fee and was owned by the restaurant. How convenient. Do all Pho places run like this?
the good here is decent, a-ok in my book. however, the ambience is a hell of a lot nicer in the bathroom than in the actual restaurant. minus one star for that one.
It's nice that they're in my neighborhood, but their pho is just so blah. I need flavor with my soup and noodles damn it. The rice they use is like bird seed too - I couldn't eat finish my meal.

Being in the service industry, I'm a stickler when it comes to good service, and the people at Jenni Pho deliver.  They were quick, attentive, and friendly.  I never once had to ask for a refill on my water, which is one of my pet peeves in a restaurant.  Granted, service isn't everything.  

The menu is limited (especially for a pho joint), but what I did have I enjoyed (The pho tai - rice noodles with rare steak).  The quantities are huge, and I wish they would give a portion choice (small and large).  

The place is clean and well lit, and parking was not an issue.  I would definitely go to this place again.

Good food. It's exactly what u expect at a Pho place. 

Good potstickers and eggrolls!

We ordered pho tai nam.  Big bowl with generous meat portions.  A lot of fat on the meat. Flavor was good, but not remarkable.  Also had boba. They had three for price of two. We ordered two Thai tea and one milk tea. We tasted both flavors.  Also, good but not remarkable. We drank one there and brought other two home and froze them for later.  I like glass window into kitchen so I can watch. Would eat there again if in the area, but would not drive across town again for Jenni Pho.

Their food and services are so so, not bad but not great.
Just remember it's CASH ONLY restaurant.
Unless you have some cash, you can use their ATM machine inside the restaurant, but the fee!!!
I would rather go to ANOTHER Jenni Pho on Spring Mountain Rd. They accept credit card.

Never had Pho before.. I loved it. I got the mango tea with boba, Pho with Steak and Flank added Shrimp
I put lime, teriyaki and siracha in it as well. My kids liked it too minus the spices. I thought it was pretty cool that they had chicken fingers and fries and stuff just in case the kids didn't like what I ordered.

Love, love, love, the spring rolls and c6 entree which is a grilled pork chop and shrimp, steamed rice, fried egg, fresh veggies, and egg roll.  First time at this location and the service was great, they have a tag team system going so you order and before you know it apps are served, meal, done.  Love it!

Jenni Pho gets a solid 3.5 stars! Rounding up because I had a positive overall experience.

- $8 - $9 for a large bowl of pho
- Plenty of vermicelli noodles, however, not so generous with the meat portions ($2 additional if you want extra meat) 
- Brisket was on point! Very tender 
- Broth is flavorful, a tad bit oily 
- Thai boba tea was delicious!! 
- Food came out quick 
- Service is extremely friendly! Ladies working were smiling and came back to refill waters often 

The service made a great impact and I had a pretty decent bowl of pho. If you live in the Southwest and get a pho craving, check out Jenni Pho!

Very disappointed in the service. If the employees don't want to be working until 10pm, then i suggest closing earlier or finding different employees. I approached the front at 9:30pm asking for a drink to-go, and the two employees chuckled as one rolled her eyes bc she had to get back up. Throughout my dinner i constantly had to get up and waive their attention since they hadn't checked up on us, or even asked for the order. There were only 3 tables seated at the time.
Very clean, friendly staff, great service and the food is better than most places I've been to. Definitely will come back and recommend to fit ends and family.

Im sad I didnt take pictures!! But anyways, I enjoyed this place.  The portion here is massive for the regular.  We got here around 7 pm on a Thursday and it was empty.  We were seated right away & they also took our drink orders right away.  

We all ordered the Jenni Pho which included all of the various types of meat.  My favorite is brisket and tendon. Yum!! They also have a kids pho which comes with coke or sprite.  It was weird though that the adults got the food before the kids.  I just believe it should be the other way around? Anyways, the broth had flavor and wasnt watered down or anything and was great.  The pho came with a big plate of veggies to accompany your soup.  I was sad that there was no culantro which is the first time ever in a pho restaurant not having it.  

Other than that, service was good & food was good! The price also was reasonable and we had a pleasent experience.

Food was decent, I've had better. This location is receiving just 2 stars because it's CASH ONLY. They have a small sign by the entrance where it's not a eye level to realize that they do not accept credit card! 

They should have a bigger sign and as a customer service, BEFORE we ordered, possibly let us know it's CASH ONLY instead after I ate and ready to pay with credit card!!!!!!!!!!! 

But I gave them a second star just because they let us leave with just a copy of our dr lic and to have us pay the next day.

I LOVE this place!! It's located on the west side of South Rainbow and Robindale/Windmill area. I've been coming in here for years.. The staff are very friendly and have been there for for years. I'm hoping that means the owner is good to their staff members & treating their hard labor work with respect & appreciation. Keep up the excellent work Jenni Pho!! God Bless you's

The food was ok.. Serving size was good but the service was horrible. Maybe it was because I was with a big group but everyone had to switch plates. I was happy to see there was an alternate option for kids. I'll stick to my other spot in china town..

The service was awesome! We had issues with our party arriving but they were just so patient and chill about it all. We also received our food within less than 15 minutes. The food was also very delicious! Huge portions and affordable prices. A lot better than getting something thats less filling and expensive on the strip. And of course best cure for a crazy night.

Being from San Jose, I'm biased because San Jose has great pho. My cousin took me here and I thought it was just OK. I didn't like the broth and my meatballs had an off taste to it.

The service was great. Too bad the food wasn't.

FINAL ANSWER: Wouldn't be my first choice, but it serves convenience and I'd go back for the sake of getting my pho fix.

This place is great. Clean, friendly staff and best tasting pho in town.  The only draw is its cash only and they seem to hold back on the basil.  I've been here at least 3 times a month for the past 5 months and I have to ask for more.  It seems they only give one sprig per person.  Come on,  basil doesn't cost that much to skimp out like this.

I'm really not that picky when it comes to pho. As long as the broth is good and the ingredients are good, it's all good! Jenni Pho meets both of those requirements. This is easily my pho place of choice if I want something relatively close to my house (and it's not past 10pm). Service is great. Their boba milk tea is also very good. Finally, I love how the kitchen is behind a glass panel, so you can see everything that goes on back there.

My boyfriend and I come here all the time and get the pho Thai, 2 for 1 dumplings, and boba milk teas. We always love the servers and it makes for a great lunch date! The pho is always great and the dumplings are amazing!! Boba is also good although a little sweet for me personally. This is the best pho restaurant we have tried.

BS +++

Pho! Pho! Phonomenal! First of, the  server was nice and quick! I ordered and within 3 minutes my food was on the table.  When I mean quick I mean QUICK! I never had fresh Pho like this  before and I had Pho in San Diego, NYC, and various spots in Vegas.  We also ordered  the fresh vegetable roll and fried spring roll.  I  have nothing but great things to say about this place.  Instead of critiquing  their food I am praising their amazing service and the owner was super nice.  My father-in-law wanted Pho and has been coming here since the opening.  It's his birthday today and the owner gave us ice cream and played HAPPY BIRTHDAY on the loud speaker.  I mean their just so hospitable and friendly.  The food was clean and the place was uber clean.  The see through kitchen proved how team work truly makes the dream work.  I am definitely coming back to this spot.  BOOKMARKED SON! 

Food is BOMB
Selection was ON POINT and NOT TOO OVERWHELMING
Restrooms are CLEAN 
Tables Clean and UPGRADED
Table wait time PLACE WAS EMPTY (1pm on a Saturday)
Take out wait time is QUICK
Customer service is GREAT
Ambiance HOMEY
Kitchen SUPER CLEAN

* Boomsauce scale.
BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage).  Not recommended.
BS = it's just O.K. (experience)
BS+ = Yo! I like this place.
BS++= That's Whoa! This place good.
